data.title: Ten-Year Low Volatility Has Locals Piling Into Brazilian Real
data.meta_description: The lowest volatility in a decade already has locals piling into bets on the Brazilian real. Foreigners should come next.
data.text:
Subdued volatility makes currency attractive for carry traders

Local funds’ long position on Brazilian real near record high

The lowest volatility in a decade already has locals piling into bets on the Brazilian real. Foreigners should come next.

The currency , which saw wild swings for most of the past decade as constant political turmoil rippled through markets and the economy, has been stuck between 4.84 and 5 per dollar since mid-2023. The odd calm — a result of relative political stability and still-high interest rates — is paving the way for the real to become one of the main destinations for emerging-market investors.
